message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180.
I'm interested in the product, but $180 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Can you meet me at that price?

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer the product to you for $160. It's a fair price considering the product's value and quality. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $160 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay up to $140 for the product. Can you consider that price?

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can offer the product to you for $152. It's a good compromise, considering the product's value and your willingness to pay. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but $152 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay up to $140, but I'm also willing to meet you in the middle of that price. How about $145?

I understand your willingness to meet me in the middle, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can offer the product to you for $148. It's a good compromise, considering the product's value and your willingness to pay. What do you think?
I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate, Alice. However, $148 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay up to $140, and I'm not budging from that price. Can you meet me there?

I understand your final offer, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer the product to you for $147. It's a very competitive price, considering the product's value. I'm not sure I can go any lower. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your efforts to negotiate, but I'm still not willing to pay more than $140. I'm willing to walk away if we can't meet at this price. I'm not interested in paying $147. Can you meet me at $140?
